title: Fraud and Friendship; or the orphan and the foundling of the King's printing-house. An Edinburgh tale. By the author of “Jessie Melville,” etc. [David Pae.]
author: Pae, David
snippet: I was born when Sir Henry was a laddie. My faither afore me had the Home Farm, and sae had 1 when this Edward got the estate; but Rackrent got in to be factur, and took a notion o' my farm, and never rested till he pat me oot o't. And now I'm only a dayr-labourer on the property.
